text: Answer: (d) Solution: Line #2: int a@b, p; // lexical error because identifier does contain @. Line #3: double d; d;; // Semantic error because the variable d; is undeclared. Line #5: p = d; // In C language, there is no any compiler error. Line #6: break; // Semantic error because there is neither any loop nor any switch So, option (d) is correct.
